member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.WcfIntegration.Async.TypeSystem.HandleProvider.GetNextHandle
member.summary: This is an ugly hack to circumvent lack of public constructor on struct.
member.remarks: Since we need RuntimeMethodHandles and the struct does not have a constructor we can use, we need some other way of obtaining these. We're stealing them from mscorlib.dll. We can (hopefully) do this, because it's only for 's Begin/End methods. Their handles are used (not that this is just internal implementation detail which can change and thus breaking my code) only as keys in the dictionary so we only need to have different ones, and we should be fine.
member.returns: Method handle of some method from mscorlib.dll

member.name: T:Castle.Facilities.WcfIntegration.Lifestyles.PerWcfOperationLifestyle
member.summary: Manages object instances in the context of WCF operation. This means that when a component with this lifestyle is requested multiple times during WCF operation, the same instance will be provided. If no WCF operation is available falls back to the default behavior of transient.

member.name: T:Castle.Facilities.WcfIntegration.Lifestyles.PerWcfSessionLifestyle
member.summary: Manages object instances in the context of WCF session. This means that when a component with this lifestyle is requested multiple times during WCF session, the same instance will be provided. If no WCF session is available falls back to the default behavior of transient.
